remarks.format:
## Remarks The `<cookieHandler>` element is a child element of the `<federatedAuthentication>` element; the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthenticationElement.CookieHandler%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to an instance of the CookieHandlerElement class. The `<cookieHandler>` element is used to configure the cookie handler used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM), which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule> class.
A cookie handler can be configured in one of the following ways:
- To configure a chunked cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element for your chunked cookie handler. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.
- To configure a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size, you can set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property as mentioned earlier, but leave both the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> properties unset.
- To configure a custom cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element that identifies the type of your custom cookie handler. This type must derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is equivalent to the `<chunkedCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element. It specifies a chunked cookie handler, an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler> class, to use. If it is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property should be set to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>. If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property is set to either of these values but the ChunkedCookieHandler property is not set, a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler.DefaultChunkSize?displayProperty=fullName>) is configured.
Either the ChunkedCookieHandler property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property may be set, but not both.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a custom cookie handler type. This property must be set when a custom cookie handler is being configured.
Docs.value: A that defines the custom cookie handler type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is equivalent to the `<customCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element. It specifies a custom cookie handler type to use. If this property is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property must be set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>. The custom type specified by this property must be derived from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class.
Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property or the CustomCookieHandler property may be set, but not both.

The cookie handler returned will be either a chunked cookie handler or a custom cookie handler depending on how the configuration properties are set. For more information, see <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement>.

## Remarks Controls whether the "HttpOnly" flag is emitted for any cookies written. Certain Web browsers honor this flag by keeping client-side script from accessing the cookie value.
Represents the `hideFromScript` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cookie handler mode.
Docs.value: A valid value that indicates the kind of cookie handler that is being configured. The default value is , which indicates a chunked cookie handler.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For chunked cookie handlers (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property is set), the mode should be set to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>. For a custom cookie handler (the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property is set), the mode should be set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>.
Represents the `mode` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.
